title: Enhancing Hospitality Practice Competencies: Development of a Taxonomy for Instructional Methods: Literature Analysis and Cluster Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Customer service competency enhancement program for service/customer-facing role practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can compare and analyze five or more instructional method classification systems through literature analysis
Learners can distinguish three types of focus (narrow, holistic, and multipurpose) in the instructional method classification system using cluster analysis.
Learners can evaluate the limitations of existing classification systems by applying validation criteria (e.g., internal consistency, user-friendliness).
Learners can design a new instructional method classification system suitable for social studies contexts through project-based collaboration.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
